Dialogue.Value: Welcome to Sorobor Academy. How can I help you?
I’m interested in signing up. What can you tell me about the Academy?
Sorobor Academy is the greatest house of learning in Aurai. Whether you want to learn history, mathematics, literature or the art of commanding an army, we have a place here for you.
Our trade networks also dwarf those of even Levant. So, if you’re looking to strike it rich, or develop connections with the best and brightest in Aurai, you’re also definitely in the right place.
Sorobor values individuals who are flexible, ambitious, and autonomous. If you think you have what it takes to learn how to be a true credit to all Aurai, you are welcome here.
I hear there’s a Ley Line in Harmattan. Where can I find it?
Try the door on the other side of the hall, the one with the crystals. It’s free to use. If you want to learn how to tap into your newfound power, we would be glad to teach you, for a fee.
I’m in! How do I sign up?
Excellent, first sign here an-.....Wait, hold on. I recognize that name...This could be troublesome...
Is there a problem?
Unfortunately yes. According to my ledger, your bloodline is currently under a rather complex Blood Price. That...Complicates things a little.
There’s got to be a way to resolve this.
Of course this damned Blood Price follows me everywhere I go...

No need to get upset, this happens frequently enough. All applicants with a Blood Price on their family need to be approved through the Provost of Academic Affairs. Give him this note, and he’ll look into this for you. He should be in the library.
There’s nothing more I can do on my end to sign you up. This is the Academic Provost’s business now. You’ll find him in the library, I believe.
I’m just looking around.
Very well. Enjoy your visit!

I’m afraid I’m swamped with work right now, visitor. I have a foot-high stack of theses to read and judge. Like this one on...Oh my. Unless he’s got a veritable stack of evidence here, this one’s destined for the rejection pile.
Hmm? Yes, I’m the Academic Provost. What’s this about? As you can see I’m quite busy.
I was told to speak with you about getting admitted into the Academy.

Hmm? Let me see that note...Ah. Yes, that would complicate your admittance here. Under normal circumstances, a Blood Price wouldn’t be too big a deal, but given how you are the only member of your bloodline, and only make a lighthouse keeper’s salary...
You think I’m a risk, don’t you?
I’m a seasoned adventurer now, I’ll have you know!

Don’t worry, we aren’t going to turn you away without giving you a chance. If we did that for every risky venture we wouldn’t be half as rich and influential as we are. You’ll just have to prove that you’re an asset first, that’s all.

I’d advise you to seek out a sponsor. Your most likely bets are the Arcane Dean, the Military Dean, or the Provost of Mercantile Affairs. They’re the ones most inclined to be receptive to you at the moment.
Our Arcane Dean, Mr Turnbull, should be around the Academy somewhere. The Military Dean, Victor Berthelot, should be around the Military District in the North-East of town.
And if your adventuring has made you rich, Our Mercatile Provost Sekiguchi Meiko would most definitely be interested in sponsoring you. She should be around the Marketplace.
Once you’ve gotten a sponsor, please have a word with Headmaster Salaberry. Show him a sponsor signature, and you’re in.

Ah, so you’ve gotten a sponsor’s signature. Excellent. Just one last step and your complex admittance case will be resolved. Please have a word with Headmaster Salaberry, and you’ll officially be a Soroborean!
Thanks for the help.
I’d better be! I hate being given the runaround like this!
Well, shoo. You have no further business with me. It’s in the headmaster’s hands now.
Ah, you. I’ve been expecting you. I see the Academic Provost has approved your application.
Yeah, after making me jump through a bunch of hoops.

If that’s a dealbreaker for you, then you might want to rethink your application to Sorobor Academy. If you intend to rise through the ranks here, you will need to put in a lot of time and diligence, whether academic or mercantile.
I’m eager for the opportunity, sir.

You’ll go far here with an outlook like that. If you intend to rise through the ranks here, you will need to put in a lot of time and diligence, whether you try seek success in the academic or mercantile realms.

You’ve proven you can be of use, so I have little doubt you’ll be able to find yourself a place here, even with your blood price payments to manage. But I do wish to impress upon you what joining Sorobor means...

When the Scourge came knocking on Harmattan’s gates, and the old nobles argued and delayed, it was us who seized the day. We formed a meritocracy, based on what each of us could do to reinvent the future.

We took our humble university, and turned it into a power to rival the entirety of the Blue Chamber Collective. To join us is to commit to being a part of that legacy. Are you prepared to rise to that challenge?

You must be bold, curious, and driven to earn not just your daily bread, but also the respect of your peers. We have a reputation for being the ones who can solve any problem, and acquire any item, and we expect you to live up to it.
(This is a turning point in my life...Am I ready to commit to the Sorobor Academy?)
Sign me up. I’ll surpass those expectations!
I need to think this over.
Then, done. Welcome to Sorobor Academy, [PlayerName]. As of this moment, you are an apprentice here.
Very well. Your application will remain open. Return whenever you feel you are ready. There’s no need to rush.

Take your time getting to know the town and academy. Once you’re settled in, try to make yourself useful, and see if one of our Deans will take you under their wing. That will be all, [PlayerName]. Off you trot.
Could you hold on just a minute please? I’m in the middle of noting down some essential things about a theory I have. I promise I’ll give you my full attention some other time, alright?
I need a sponsor in order to join the Academy. Can you help?

I’m not sure that I-...Oh hey! I know that name! My sister-in-law Helen has written about you! I hear that you got involved with a large trade expedition on just a Lighthouse keeper’s pay. You must be exceptionally resourceful to pull that off!
It would have been more impressive if the ship didn’t sink on home’s doorstep...
Anytime you take a risk, you roll the dice. Sometimes they come up snake eyes. That’s life.
That I am, sir.
And confident too! Yes, I think your presence at the academy will be a boon to us all.
Well, I’m convinced you might be of use to us. Tell you what, If you’re a mage, I’ll sponsor you. If you’re not one already, feel free to use our Ley Line, it’s open to the public.

Ah, you’re a mage! I can tell by the way you carry yourself. Alright, let me sign that for you...And done! Bring that back to the Academic Provost, and you should be let in without any further trouble.

Ah, a visitor to Harmattan! Welcome! My name is Victor Berthelot, I am the Dean of military affairs here. Never forget, the Antique Plateau is an extremely dangerous place. If you need protection, the Wolfgang Mercenaries are there to help!

Oh, you poor soul, they’re making you run all over the place for this aren’t they? Alright, I’ll do you a favor and sign off on this. Just to keep this an even trade though, I’ll need a little something in return.

Come back with a Power Coil and I’ll gladly become your official sponsor. You should be able to get one from the marketplace, or from one of the Human-shaped Golems out there. Be wary, those Golems pack a punch!
I’ve got the item you wanted!

Ah, excellent. I hope you didn’t get hurt on my account. There, your form is signed! I hope to work with you again in the future, [PlayerName]! If there’s ever anything you need, I’ll be here for you. Go get ‘em!
Amba, good visitor! Welcome to the Harmattan Market! Feel free to sample goods from all over the continent, all in one convenient place.
A sponsor, hmm? Let me see that...Ah. You have a Blood Price, no? Then this will be simple. Prove to me you can stay on top of your finances, and this is a done deal as far as I’m concerned.
Bring me 200 Silver as a down payment on your tuition, and I’ll sign that sponsorship form for you, no further questions asked.
Deal. Here’s your money.
A wise investment on your part. Here you are, your form is signed. Now, go forth and generate wealth and power for us all, Apprentice!
So, you’re here to join the Academy too, eh? Just got done signing up, myself. The name’s Desy.

And that guy over there is Artois. He’s a bit of a softy, nearly got himself killed fighting a single Pistol Shrimp by the lake after all, but I feel like he’s got potential. With a heart like his, a little more discipline and strength might almost make a hero outta him.
So, where are you from?
Born and raised in a war camp near Karaburan. I spent my childhood sharpening swords, making traps and gathering medicine for the warriors, and my youth learning to face the Scourge in combat.

Our camps and traps and patrols are what keep so many Scourge confined to the Gates of Catharsis. While Elatt takes much of the credit, and I will admit he’s a big help, it’s our blood and sacrifice that keeps the worst of the hordes at bay.
I take it you have a plan in mind for your time here?

I’ll side with any branch that’ll help me get the connections I need. I’m not here so much to learn things, but rather to meet the people I’ll need to know to make sure my war camp is well-supplied and the most prepared to face the Scourge.

I’ve got my eyes on the Military branch, but if I turn out to be a natural at Alchemy, or Engineering, or Magic, I’ll pick whatever works for me. Like I said, I’m not here to play student. I’ve got a lot of people back home who are counting on me.
Well, good luck!
Likewise. Look after yourself out there. The only one you can trust to keep you safe is yourself and your sword arm!
Ah, here to join Sorobor as well? I’m Artois Sutherland, pleasure to make your acquaintance!

That girl over there, Desy, we were in the same caravan to Harmattan when we got ambushed by a Pistol Shrimp near the lake. She’s real strong. That said, she cares more than she lets on. She’s surprisingly gentle when applying first aid to people!

I’m from the Sutherland family. We’re pretty big back in Berg, although we haven’t quite been so prominent in the last decade or two. How Rissa Aberdeen manages to keep so much influence with such a narrow bloodline, I will never understand.

Mother would have preferred I try to study to become a chamberlord, or join my cousin Julius as a hunter. But becoming a member of Sorobor Academy and helping create the future of Aurai through research and trade has long been my dream.

I’m hoping to join the History Division and become a Scholar or even someday a Master there. There is just so much of our ancestor’s lives buried under the carnage the Scourge unleashed, and I want to know all of it!

Then again, Victor Berthelot was already kind enough to help me out. Maybe it’s a sign that I’m more suited to join the Military Branch. Being a hero, and protecting the innocent would suit me just fine too.
Good luck to you too! If you sign up to join Sorobor as well, I hope we get to work together! More hands make for light work, after all!
What’s it like, working for Sorobor Academy?

Ah! Yes, I can see why you’d be curious. Sorobor Academy is a storied institution, going back to even before the Scourge. It’s more than just a place of learning. It’s where the greatest minds in Aurai congregate to shape its future.

As long as you can put in the work, you’ll get quite a bit out of it. Connections, wealth...It asks a lot of hard work out of you, and years of effort before you see a payoff, but I can’t imagine living any other way.
I’d like to join Sorobor Academy. How would I go about doing that?
Hmmm...I’d recommend you concentrate on not losing your lighthouse first, [PlayerName]. Speak with me once that’s been resolved, one way or another.

A worthy goal, [PlayerName]. Yes, I think you’d fit right in. I’m planning on making the journey to our home city, Harmattan right now, actually! If you’d like a lift, I can absolutely take you along! ...For a fee, of course.
Best of luck to you on your journey, my friend!
Welcome to Harmattan, friend! If you want to speak with anyone important, I’d advise you to visit Sorobor Academy. If you’re into magic, they’ve got a Ley Line open for public use too!
A visitor huh? Make sure you take a walk around the central market. There are plenty of wonderful goods from all across Aurai for sale there!
Just when I’m done evaluating one stack of theses, another one shows up. It’s enough to make even a bookworm like myself begin to detest paperwork!
I’m looking for work, is there anything I can do?
Go bother one of the Deans. I’m sure they have plenty of grunt work for an apprentice like you to do. Don’t come bother me again.
So, is there a place for me in your branch of the academy?
I’ve done what you asked!
I was so close in that last experiment, I can feel it. If I can just find the right runic combination...Hmm? Well, what do you want? I’m rather preoccupied right now.
Actually, yes, there’s something you can do for me. I need a Purity Potion. I use them when doing experiments on the Scourge, and I’m fresh out.
Excellent work, apprentice. Keep this up and you’ll make Initiate in a matter of months!
Wait...Months?
There aren’t any shortcuts in Sorobor, no matter what Victor will tell you. The man seems too eager to snap up new apprentices for my liking, even if he is the best at what he does. I don’t like it.

Every artifact and ruin we discover is a new source of heartbreak. We’ve lost so much because of the Scourge. Not just people, but culture, literature and who knows what else. We owe it to those who lost their lives to remember what they lived for.
You want to help me? You? Then stay out of any ruins you might find, and whatever you do, don’t plunder anything you find there!

There are valuable historical relics out there and uncultured goons making off with them for some quick silver will just rob everyone else of their history. Stick to driving off bandits. They’re even worse when it comes to respecting our shared history.
How can I become an initiate if I can’t take on all the jobs that I can?

Go pester Victor Berthelot if you want a hand out! We don't exactly have much crossover in our fields of study, but I only hear good things about him. And he’s often willing to take a chance on new initiates.

It’s always so upsetting when an upstart apprentice goes and runs their mouth! That potion of extreme stamina restoration would have sold like poutine on a winter’s day. So what if overuse leads to heart failure? That’s no reason to ban it!

Ah, you’re one of our new apprentices. Be a dear and give me a hand, will you? Gather 2 Nightmare Mushrooms and give them to my man at the low-class inn. His name’s Pete. I’ll pay you for your trouble.
Oh, and by the way, make sure to let him know his “order of spices has arrived”. Got it? Because that’s what this is. A spice delivery. Got that?
Aren’t those...Poisonous?
That’s what some of my alchemists say, but I also hear it’s a very widely used spice in meat stews, so who’s to say, eh?
Thank you for handling that delivery! Here, your cut.
I get the feeling that you just had me deliver poison to a bandit...
I didn’t just participate in some kind of drug deal, did I?
How RUDE of you! This is a perfectly legitimate spice trade! It’s completely ethical and above board!
Anyway, keep it up, Apprentice! With an attitude like that, you’ll make Initiate by the end of the year!
End of the year?! There’s no quicker way?
Well, Victor Berthelot sometimes takes on Initiates pretty quickly. Don’t believe any of the rumors about him, mind you. The other Deans just want to poach his Initiates once he whips 'em into shape.
Ugh, I hate Harmattan. Too crowded, too many people. Too many potential places for a threat to hide. I feel so much safer outside the walls. At least out there, I know everything is a threat.
Your...Err...Order of spices has arrived?
Ah, ‘bout time. Gimme. Go tell our mutual friend thanks, will you? Now shoo.
Erica sent me to deliver some Nightmare Mushrooms.
Quiet, you fool! Didn’t she tell you the pass-phrase? *Sigh* Fine, hand ‘em over and shoo, will you?
Oh hey there. Don’t mind me, I’m just juggling about 4 potential projects right now. There’s so much lost technology that I desperately want to reverse engineer and surpass!
Oh, perfect timing, then! I'm testing the effect of Leyline Water as Golem fuel. Can you run down to the Mana Lake and fetch me some?
That’s exactly what I need. Good work, Apprentice! Some of my initiates will be very thankful for your work!

Eh, maybe eventually. You’re getting a little ahead of yourself, Apprentice. You should take some classes, prove you know something. Do some business, prove you can make something, you know? You’re trying to jump the curve by a couple months!

Well, you can always see if Victor Berthelot’s got anything needing doing...I don’t particularly get on well with him, but he does often take an interest in new Apprentices. He might be able to give you a leg up.
I’m currently dealing with a difficult contract with the Wolfgang Mercenaries, Apprentice. I don’t have time right now. Come back in a bit, alright?
Ah, one of the new Apprentices. Looking for some work? The Military branch is always looking for some new brave souls to protect Aurai!
I’m looking for something big. Something that will lift me out of Apprenticeship.

The other academy branches are yanking your chain, aren’t they? Typical. I feel like everyone in this damned academy enjoys taking advantage of the new hires and demands things of them with nary a thought for their well being.
Well, don’t worry, I’ll look out for you. I was in your shoes once. In fact, work with me and I can guarantee that I’ll take care of your monthly Blood Price payments for you.

You say that you’re ready to take on something on the Initiate level, do you? Alright, I have JUST the task for you. I won’t sugar coat it, the job is going to be dangerous. But if you pull this off, I’ll recommend you for a much faster promotion.
I’m in. What do you need me to do?
No thanks. I’ll do this the right way.

Excellent. I’ve got two other apprentices, Artois and Desy, on jobs out in Antique Plateau. They’re handling two deliveries that have ended up a little...Complicated. I’d like you to run support for them and help them out with both their tasks.

Well, enjoy being a glorified errand runner for the next year or two, then. The only way to really rise up in the Academy is to be bold and ambitious. Those who try to do things “the right way” never really go anywhere.

First, a package was supposed to come from Sirocco, but the courier was robbed by bandits up near the northern lake. I need you to head up there, find the bandits, and recover the package. They’re likely to be hunkered down in some ruins.
I don’t care if you use violence or diplomacy. Just recover the box. It’s about this small, and has the wax seal of Sirocco on it. It’s confidential, so do NOT open it. Got that, [PlayerName]?

Secondly, I have a sensitive delivery that needs picking up. Head out from the south elevator, then cut north-east through the downtown ruins. There should be a tiny ruin that’s up against the Harmattan cliff wall. My contact should be inside.

The...ah...Person I’m expecting is a little...Different. Don’t attack them or do anything rash. I just want the item with as little trouble as possible. Just give him this glass bottle, and let him do the rest.

I sent Artois to deal with the bandits and Desy to deal with the cave pickup. Not that I’m too worried, but I’d sleep better at night knowing there’s someone double checking their work. Like I said, it’s a dangerous mission. Good luck!
Ah, good, you’re all back. Looks like it’s a good thing I sent you along, [PlayerName]. Do you have the little box from Sirocco?
Yes I do. We really need to talk about what you asked us to do.
Come now, I did tell you it would be a dangerous mission, didn’t I?
The wax seal on the box is broken...I sincerely hope that was the bandits doing and not yours. I told you the contents were confidential!
So we don’t have the right to know what kind of product we’re delivering?

We are just an intermediary, so no, we don’t. All that matters to us is that we get the goods where they need to go. What the goods actually are is irrelevant. You’ll sleep better not poking your nose into these kinds of things.
The bandits broke the seal, yeah.

Really, now... And yet the contents of the box are still inside. I find it very unlikely that they’d have left Tsar Stones inside if they knew what was in it. Well, whatever. The goods are here, that’s all that matters.
Ah, the box is still sealed, excellent. I hope the bandits gave you no trouble?
They gave ME trouble, that’s for sure. I’m sorry, boss. I should have been more vigilant.
Tsk tsk, sounds like you need some training, Artois. Fortunately, you’re in the right place for it. I’ll have you in fighting shape in no time.
And what about my contact at the cave? Did you get the blood from him?
It turned into a fight. The damn creature nearly killed me!
Dammit, I warned you not to-...And now the bottle is cracked! There’s going to be even less for the Naturalist branch to work with. Use your heads next time, you fools!
I have your bottle of blood. And I killed the Butcher afterwards.
You...You what?! I...Alright, consider me quite impressed. I’m going to send someone to bring the corpse in for research. Well done, both of you.
You’re...Not mad that it ended up like that?
Why would I be mad? You accomplished your objective, brought me the blood, AND you rid the world of an extremely dangerous creature all in one trip. I’d say everyone wins here.
Yes. I have the blood. What in Elatt’s name do you need this for?

As for what these things are for, I don’t know, and I don’t plan to know. I was paid a great deal of money to ensure these goods get where they need to be, and that’s all any of us need to know. Discretion is a skill all three of you should learn.

Well then, I’ll be keeping a close eye on all of you. One or two more jobs like this, and I’ll take you under my wing as Initiates. For now, enjoy a very happy payday with the promise of many more to come!

Don’t bother. I’m done doing anything for you. You were working with the Butcher of Men, the most monstrous Scourge there is, and you don’t even care why your client arranged for it. That goes beyond merely being irresponsible!
I cannot work under someone who is willing to work with humanity’s greatest enemy. Especially not if they can’t even justify their actions!

Think for a moment, girl. Do you think I would have made this arrangement and not have taken measures to ensure he does not leave the region alive? I informed the Wolfgang Mercenaries about this delivery before even sending you off.
Oh. That’s not so bad then. They’re professionals, I’m sure they’ve already got that thing cornered by now!
They will make certain that the Butcher does not leave the region alive. Not unless he gets extremely lucky. So you see, I didn’t make a deal with him. I used him. There’s a difference.
I don’t see much difference, to be honest. Nothing good can come from trading with that monster.

Tsk, you should really consider the benefits of diplomacy, dear. Besides, I’m working on solutions to slaughter the Scourge with greater efficiency already. Would your family want you to walk away from the opportunity to destroy the lot of them?
I know they wouldn’t want me to work with a man who is willing to do business with the creature that killed several of them. And I think the Headmaster might agree.
There’s no need to be so nasty, girl. Besides, no one would believe a fresh Apprentice over a Dean who’s put in years of loyal service keeping the Antique Plateau safe and secure.
And even if anyone DID...Well, I’m just asking you to consider the harm that might be done to innocent people if our military’s ability to fight the Scourge is compromised, that’s all.
Ugh, fine! But I’m still done taking orders from you.
I’m out too. I’m not working with someone who is willing to work with the Butcher!

Well, see, that’s a shame. Because if you’re out, who is going to keep paying off your Blood Price, hmm? I guarantee you that no one else in this organization will help a liability like yourself. ...I’ll make sure of that.
Your only option for success is to stick with me, [PlayerName]. So I suggest you stop questioning me and do as you’re told. I could make life VERY miserable for you if you don’t.
As long as our deal is still good, I’ll stay.
Ah, the deal about your Blood Price? Don’t worry, I’ve already sent along this month’s payment. You can trust me, [PlayerName]. I look after my assets.

In any case, you all completed your missions. Enjoy your reward. Come back in a few days and I’ll have plenty more work for you to do, [PlayerName]. I have some very interesting research being done that I think you and Artois will enjoy.
Well, well, another visitor. Well, you know what they say, dark is the night without a moon...
Is that some kind of pass-phrase?
If it was, you clearly don’t know the response, now do ya? Start talking, or start emptying those pockets, tourist, before we empty ‘em for ya!
There’s a package you intercepted. Hand it over. This doesn’t have to get violent.

Yeah, boyo over there had the same story. Well, you ain’t gettin’ it, it’s ours now. ...Although...Our operatin’ budget’s been a little tight for a while...Alright, I can see parting with that item and ONLY that item if you bring me what I we need.
So, resupply us with 5 sticks of ordinary Meat Jerky, one waterskin, an Iron Claymore and an Iron Halberd. You bring those, we trade you the little box, and we let your little buddy go. Sound fair?
That’s surprisingly fair. Alright, I’ll be back with your goods.
Elatt be praised, someone who’s reasonable and doesn’t think they’re some kind of badass! Alright, we’ll be waiting for you.
No deal. Hand it over or I’ll crack your skulls.
Well, can’t say we weren’t reasonable. Whupp ‘em, gang!
Here’s your resupply. Now hand over that box with Sirocco’s wax seal on it.
Alright, alright, don’t blow a blood vessel. Everybody wins here today. Alright, let’s see where I put that...Ah, here’s the box for you. Now, take that coddled Sutherland boy and skedaddle, got it?
Pack it up, people! Let’s get lost before the Wolfgang start pokin’ around here!
I spent days laboriously copying history books into blank ones, and the Dean barely paid me for it! Said I should be doing it for the love of history. That won’t put bread on my plate!
There has to be a better way to climb the ranks than by endless thankless work! I’m better than this! All systems have shortcuts...I just need to figure out the one for this Academy...

Thanks for helping me out, [PlayerName]. I thought I could negotiate with these guys. Turns out they thought ransoming me might be more profitable for them. *sigh* That’ll show me for assuming people still have common decency.
Normally bandits don’t negotiate. The fact they were open to it at all is strange...

Huh. You’re right. I’m fairly certain they were using a passphrase as well. I wonder...Do you think someone in Harmattan’s got a deal going with them? It would explain who’s giving them an “operating budget”.
And all that trouble for a little box like that. I’m mighty curious to know what’s inside that Victor wants so badly.
(Break the wax seal and open the box)
(Two glimmering gems greet your eyes...They appear to have been forged with an exceptionally sharp point on one end, with an empty bulb on the other)
Is that...Elatt’s name, those are Tsar Stones! They seem to have been forged into...Bullets, look like. Not sure what that glass bulb is supposed to be used for, though...
(Don’t open the box)
Come on, we risked our lives for that thing! ...Oh, fine. You’re right, actually. We’re supposed to be professionals.
I’ll head back to Harmattan. Thanks for the assist, [PlayerName]! I owe you one!
Why’d you even try to negotiate with bandits? They’re already outlaws, Artois!

I mean...That’s fair. But bandits are still people. They have their own reasons for operating outside society. Assuming they’re all pure evil might be common sense, but they’re still human and should be given basic dignity. They’re not Scourge, after all.
Ah, there you are! Glad you made it back safe too!

At least my labor back in the war camps was silently appreciated. I feel like half the people I’ve done work for are just using me. I can read it in their body language as they turn away once we’re done doing business.
I get the impression that unless I do something that really makes me stand out, climbing up the social ladder here is going to take ages. Hmm...How can I prove I’m worth my salt...
(Desy seems barely conscious, she looks like she’s taken a serious strike to the ribs)
Ach...I definitely cracked a rib in that fight. Thanks again for bailing me out, friend.
Another one...Who is your master, human? Speak or die.
Umm...I work for Victor? Are you the...err...Person who has something for him?
Victor sent me. He wasn’t kidding when he said you were different!
Finally. Hand me that jar of glass. This exchange leaves me open and vulnerable, and I want it over and done with NOW.
(The glowing Immaculate punctures an organ along it’s arm, and pours a steady stream of hissing black blood into it until the jar is full)
It is done. Take this to your master. Ensure it is given to whom it was intended. Do not break it, for if you do, I will take your life as vengeance for wasting my blood.
And...What exactly do you intend we do with your blood?

Hsss...Why would I tell you and spoil the element of surprise? I did not become the apex predator of all life by being foolish. Your master knows who this must be given to, and what must be done with it.
No...Don’t let him leave...Stop him!
Wait, is that Desy back there?! What did you do to her?!
This one attacked me. It is a brainless creature. I am not some weak-willed beast who feels guilt over their actions. No. I was born to kill and fight. It stood no chance against me.
You’re no ordinary Immaculate...What ARE you?
You puny things call me the Butcher. You speak it in fear. So, I like it. It makes my two hearts throb with purpose.
He’s...The most vicious Immaculate known to man. He can’t...We can’t let him escape!
Why should I change who I am? Why should I care about harm done to anything that isn’t like me? Slaughter makes me feel satisfied. It relieves my suffering. So tell me, human. Why should I stop?
Can you say your kin are any different? Your human city is built upon the death of hundreds. I can hear their blood wailing in the walls. This city will die, one way...Or another.
You feel no guilt over the harm and slaughter you’ve caused? Really?

Whatever made me the way I am did so for a reason. Why should I argue with them? My killer’s instinct...It is why I exist. It guides me to slay our true enemy. Until the day comes when I can kill him, I will have to settle for killing base animals like you.
Animals?! You’ve...killed thousands! You claim intelligence, but...Gah...You are nothing more than a bloodthirsty monster! Evil incarnate!

Tsss...This one clearly did not learn its lesson. It is very fortunate that I will not be killing it today, though I very much want to. I cannot accept more delays leaving this place full of nasty steel beasts.
Stand aside, human. Do not bar my way, or you will suffer my wrath.
Go ahead, leave. I hope we never cross paths again...
You are a wise little human. Because if we do meet again, I will have no reason to spare you.
No. I can't let a monster like you get away alive.
Brainless, like the other one! I will enjoy your death, puny one. Die, and take my pain away!
Dammit, you let him go. How many innocent people did we just doom to be slaughtered at his hands?
You said he’s the most vicious Immaculate ever known. He would have killed me.

...Alright, that’s fair. You’d have to be at least as strong as a Champion of Elatt to stand a chance against him in single combat. The fact that I’m still breathing is already a miracle. You did the smart thing, [PlayerName]. I can’t fault you for it.
The mission was to just get the “delivery”. I’m not risking losing that promotion.

If he kills anyone else after this, their blood is on your hands. Don’t you ever forget that. Friends I grew up with have been killed by that thing. The Scourge may be instinctively drawn to destruction, but the Butcher is far worse. He REVELS in it.
Y-you did it. I don’t believe it. You killed the Butcher of Men! I...I can’t quite believe my eyes!
Looks like I’m just that good.
Huh. I guess you’re right. Well, don’t let that go to your head. You know what they say about pride and falls. Still...Thank you. I knew people who were killed by that thing.
Same here. I guess I was just better prepared, and a little lucky.
Heh. Don’t be so modest. Come on, luck or not, you still killed the Butcher of Men. I owe you, [PlayerName]. I’ve lost friends to that damnable monster.
I wonder why he wanted to deliver his blood to Victor?

I don’t know. I’m going to be having some very serious words with him when I return to Harmattan. Dealing with Immaculates...It’s bad enough. But the Butcher? He embraces violence and evil. Only a madman or a fool would make a bargain with him.
Do you need help getting back to Harmattan?

I’ll be fine getting back on my own. I have a few potions in my bag to patch myself up. I’ll let them work their magic and head back on my own once I’m well enough to sprint. Go on ahead without me, I’ve been hurt worse before.

Ugh...The weapons that the Scourge use are downright soaked in corruption and the Butcher’s is no exception. I’m going to need to clean this wound VERY carefully. I have no intention of dying from a Scourge infection in some unknown cave!
Oh, thank Elatt, I thought we were both done for...This is the first I’ve ever heard of the Butcher of Men sparing anyone...What in Aurai is he planning that he’s willing to spare lives?!
Did you hear? The recent trade caravan from Sirocco got waylaid by outlaws! It was near Golem Lake, just North of Harmattan!
Bandits came charging down from the cliffside above the lake, and robbed them blind before scurrying back up the mountain trail! I was counting that delivery of fine silk, dammit!
One of our explorer patrons just came back from a trip around the edge of the region. He claims he saw an Immaculate that glowed blue, and that it was camping with...Some kind of monstrous giant.
I don’t believe the Ash Giants get along with the Scourge, so...Honestly, I’m willing to chalk it up to the man having one too many bottles of wine that night.
You are from Cierzo, no? I have heard worrisome rumors of pirates and bandits planning an attack...If you have time, I would suggest you return there and see if they are true.
I’m afraid I’m quite busy, [PlayerName]. Unless it’s urgent, I have no time for you.
I don’t have any new work for you just yet, [PlayerName]. I’m still waiting on some news from the Naturalist branch. Feel free to take a few days off.
[PlayerName], there you are! I’ve got work for you. The Naturalist division’s come back to me with some of their findings on the blood you retrieved for us, and I need you to act on them.
So...What did they do with the Butcher’s blood?

Shh, keep that to yourself! But yes, there was enough left over to do a bit of experimentation. And we discovered some interesting properties the blood has. I have a new Power Coil design in mind, and I need you to get the first prototype ready.
I don’t see the connection. What does Scourge blood have to do with a Power Coil?

According to the Naturalist branch, Scourge blood emits a certain kind of energy. They theorize that’s how the Scourge can tell each other apart. And Scourge less intelligent than an Immaculate don’t attack their own kind. It’s in their nature not to.

Furthermore, when exposed to an electric charge, and some small-scale spellcraft, Scourge blood will be attracted to other sources of Scourge blood. Essentially, we can use it to give our Golems the ability to track Scourge beasts more effectively.
So...to sum up, if we use these new Power Coils in our Golems, not only will they be able to track down the Scourge, but better stalk them and infiltrate their tunnels? That’s quite the breakthrough!
Exactly, Artois! This kills multiple birds with one stone. If, that is, it works in practice. Hence, why I’m asking you to go see a contact of mine to make a prototype.
Why not just ask the Engineering division to design it?

And have them take all the credit? No, I want to do this my way. We’re going to use one of my contacts in Levant to design the prototype. Once I’m sure the design will work as intended, I’ll contract the Engineering branch for full production.
I need you to head to the city of Levant in Abrassar Desert. My contact there will give you the details of the task at hand. Give him this package, he’ll know what to do.

Speak to one of our Caravaners and see if he’ll give you a lift, at least partway there. Levant’s the great big city in the East of the desert. The man you’re looking for is named Orsten , the engineer.
Do you want me to grab my backpack and give [PlayerName] a hand on the journey, Victor?

No, I want you working with the Wolfgang Mercenaries, Artois. They’ve found a cache of broken Golems in the mountains, and I want someone I can trust to make sure none go “missing”, if you catch my drift. We need as many as we can get.
Now remember, [PlayerName], your next few blood price payments will depend on your performance here. So make sure you put your back into it, Apprentice!
Wait, I thought you said you’d guarantee that you’d cover my blood price!
Well, yes. But I can’t support a liability at my own expense, you know. That’s not how the real world works. You need to earn your keep, [PlayerName].
You’re seriously using me.

I don’t appreciate your attitude. You are the one who came to ME for a quick rise up the social ladder here, and you want me to pay your Blood Price for you. I’d say it is YOU who is using ME, Apprentice.
Alright, I’m on it.
Ah, you’re back. Did you bring the new Power Coil prototype?
Yes, here it is.
...Huh. This seems like the absolute minimum job. Are you sure you didn’t slack off? If you aren’t being passionate about the work, don’t expect to get anything out of it!

Mmm...Alright, this is a little less well designed than I expected, but I guess it’ll have to do. It does prove that the theory is sound at least. I’m going to see to it that it gets a few solid field tests in.
Ah, yes, this looks good. The design seems solid. I’ll run a field test or two to see just how well it performs, and have the Engineering branch start making more of these.
Oh. Oh wow. Yes, this is exactly what I was hoping for. Excellent work. As soon as we get a full field test done, I’ll have the Engineering branch start making as many of these as we can afford.

I’ll be glad to test it out for ya. We have just the operation in mind, actually. We’ve tracked a pack of Immaculates to a canyon cave and have ‘em cornered. With this new Coil in one of our Golems, we can spring a trap on ‘em and wipe ‘em out.
Ah, this is Henri. He’s the leader of the Wolfgang Mercenaries. One of his scouts discovered some Immaculates squatting in a cave nearby.
Heh, if you want, come on and join us later. We’d be glad to show one of Victor’s mates how it’s done out there!
Anyway, you’re free for now. Here, your reward for the job. I will let you know the next time I need you.
That’s all? For such a long journey?
I don’t appreciate that tone, [PlayerName]. Someday you’ll appreciate all that I do for you.
Let me know when there’s something else I can do!
I will indeed, Apprentice. You’re proving to be quite an asset! A little longer and your promotion is guaranteed!
I’ve got nothing more for you, right now. Come back in a few days, [PlayerName].
(You still have that package to deliver to Gregory Turnbull, the Arcane Dean...)
I know what you did. And I won’t be played for a fool. How could you turn on me after all I’ve done for you?
All you’ve done? You’ve been using me from the start.
You’ve made the worst kind of enemy possible, betrayer. You’ll come to regret your foolish action.
I believe in Turnbull’s ideas.
So, you’re just so sensitive and foolish you let Turnbull play you. If I were you, I’d be wary of any food he gives you, in case he decides to start his Wendigo experiments again.
Victor sent me to get some help from you, to make a prototype Power Coil.
Ah, I’ve been waiting for you. Do you have Mr Berthelot’s package?
Here you go. He said you’d know what to do with it.
So, this is distilled Immaculate blood, huh? I don’t know how you Soroboreans got it, nor how you distilled it, but I can work with this. Let’s see if Victor’s little theory will hold water...

I was hoping to have everything I needed to start work on the coil right away, but unfortunately I’m missing some essential components and most of the city’s mercenaries are too busy hunting down the Sand Corsairs to help me out.

Victor told me you can handle a little danger. I’ll need you to acquire a few things from in an old ruin called the Electric Lab. It’s to the North, down from the cliff we’re on. An explorer has confirmed all that we need is in there, you just need to find them.

I absolutely need a chunk of the huge red crystal that’s been reported deep in the bowels of the lab. Without a piece of a Heavily Corrupted Mana Stone, there’s no way for this Coil to properly hold the charge while surrounded by Immaculate Blood.
If you can also supply a bottle of Lightning Grease, three replacement valves, and a normal Power Coil, things would go significantly smoother.

For the Lightning Grease, keep an eye out for some kind of green-ish metal vessel that’s steaming hot. For the replacement valves, there’s bound to be a supply closet with spare parts in there somewhere.
You’re asking for quite a bit of stuff...
Like I said, I only REALLY need a chunk of the large red crystal, but the end result will be considerably better the more of the other parts you bring in.
Can’t you send the guy who confirmed that these things are in the Electric Lab?
He’s long gone. The guy lost his partner to a Hive Lord and gave up on adventuring entirely. I can’t say I blame him, after a loss like that.
I’ll be back when I have the components you need, then.
I have the items you needed.
Are you certain? I want the items all at once. If there is something you are missing, go get it now.
I have everything I want to hand over. Here’s that Corrupted crystal you wanted...

Wow, when that adventurer said the Mana Stone had been “Corrupted” he wasn’t kidding. Then again...The Devourer was slain above that lab...The blood leaking into the place must have...*cough* Yes, this altered Mana crystal will do nicely.
Here’s a bottle of Lightning Grease.
Perfect, that’ll help this thing maintain a charge for considerably longer. Mr Berthelot’s instructions did say efficiency was important!
I’ve got your three replacement valves.

Thank you. I’ll make some tweaks to these, and then Victor can replace the Power Coil housing in his Golems with these modified ones. They’ll provide a much smoother power transfer, allowing for more raw power when needed.
I’ve got a spare power coil for you.

Ah, thank you. There’s a few small parts in these that I’m going to need to use...Making new Power Coils from scratch is a science we haven’t completely figured out, but we’re getting closer with each new one.
That’s all I have for the job.
Alright, I’ve gotten most of the unit’s housing prepared while you were out. Give me just a moment to put it all together and test it...

Jolly good. This prototype looks like it’s going to hold up just fine. I wouldn’t rely on it for heavy duty work, but I’m sure your people at the Academy will be able to refine the design further. Tell Mr Berthelot it was nice doing business with him.

Oh, by the way, while you’re in Harmattan, mind delivering this other item to the Arcane Dean, a Mr Turnbull? He’d put in a request for a device to measure runic frequencies not long ago, and I’ve just now put the finishing touches on it.
You keep asking a LOT from me, you know.
How about I pay you for the transport in advance? You’re going to Harmattan anyway, so what’s the big deal?
Well, as long as I’m going there, sure.
Alright, see to it that both items get where they are needed. Don’t forget to put in a good word for me with both of them! I need all the good business I can get!
Oy! I told you that punk was workin’ with em! Activate the barrier!
(You can’t manually disable the barrier while under attack!)
(With great care, you rip open one of the panels on the side of the barrier generator. It will take a bit of time and effort disable it safely, but it’s well within your ability to do)
(With the barrier disabled, Desy will be able to meet up with the Immaculates, and smuggle their leader into Harmattan! Your mission is complete!)
Ugh, when will that runic frequency metronome be finished? It’s been weeks since I commissioned it! And STILL no word from that damnable Levant artisan!
Well, here it is. An engineer in Levant asked me to deliver this to you.
(You have the item he requested...But it’s probably for the best to finish your job for Victor first.)
Ah! Thank you for handling the delivery! I’ve been doing some experiments on the effect of runes on the Scourge, and this should be of extreme assistance to my work.
Speaking of Scourge...Be on the lookout. There’s a gang of Immaculates camping in a canyon nearby. Victor’s got the Wolfgang to go kill them, thankfully.
Victor...What? Oh damn. Damn! How did he find them?
Is something wrong? What’s the issue with him killing a few Immaculates?
The Immaculates he mentioned to you...If they really are the ones hiding in that canyon cave up North, I think they’re the ones who are working with me.
Wait, what do you mean you’re working with Immaculates?!

Hold! It’s not what it sounds like. I think I’ve found a way to eliminate their killing urge. And I need an Immaculate to test my theory on. If Victor kills them...Then it could be years before I have another opportunity to test the theory like this!

I can tell you have doubts. Let me prove it to you. Come to my laboratory. I guarantee that if I show you my work, you’ll change your mind. See that circular panel on the floor, behind this pillar? Lift it up and come down to my hidden workspace.
There are secret passages in this Academy?!
Well, yes. Back when the old nobility used to run things, it was the only way to perform research they didn’t approve of. Now, move it! There’s a lot on the line!
Thank you for coming. Desy tells me you two already know each other.
Yeah, [PlayerName] was working with Victor too. And being exploited over their Blood Price. He turned around and held that over your head, didn’t he, [PlayerName]?
You said you’d be able to convince me. So convince me.

So, first, I was trying to discover a way to destroy the Scourge with magic. They have a deep connection with the Corruption, so I wanted to find a way to use long-lasting runes to dispel it, and essentially starve the entire horde.

Then, I noticed something odd. The Scourge have a much deeper connection to Rune Magic than I thought. So...See that Illuminator in the cage? I was able to, with considerable injury to myself, I might add, apply some runes onto its body.

With the right combinations of runes, I was able to alter it’s behaviour. A few tests later, and I was convinced. The Scourge’s urge to kill all living things, and especially their instinct to hunt Elatt, is actually an invocation from a spell.

In fact, when I took a closer look at some Scourge blood that the Naturalist division was working on, I confirmed even the blood itself reacts violently. Everything about the Scourge’s base nature is controlled by that spell’s command.

Then, with the corpse of the Butcher of Men that the Naturalist branch was so kind to loan me, I confirmed that in Immaculates, that spell is applied in a much more focused manner. It’s harder to change, but still allows for them to retain their free will and intelligence.

And if there’s a spell involved...There’s a counter-spell that can mitigate the effect. I am convinced that we can eliminate the killing urge from the entirety of the Scourge. Remove their instinct to kill Ellat and their urge to harm everything else.
And...What’s the point of that? They’re still monsters, right?
Wait...If it’s possible to do that...That could change everything.
Follow my logic and imagine what this means for a moment...If the Scourge are directed to desire violence via a spell, and we break that spell... What happens next?

Your typical Scourge beasts become nothing more than wild animals. Rather than attack and harm everything around them, they’ll only kill what violates their territory or safety. It will significantly reduce the scale of their rampages.

And as for the Immaculates...They are intelligent, yet they are driven by instinct to kill Elatt. Because this task is impossible, they lash out against all living things in their frustration. If you remove that killing urge, what would an intelligent species do?

Some will carry on as usual, because it’s what they know. Others will choose to do something else with their lives. Others may side against the Scourge who seek violence, in hopes that it will secure peace with humanity.

The entire brains behind the Scourge horde will fall into utter and complete chaos. Chaos that can be exploited. It will make dealing with the Scourge considerably easier, and cut the number we need to kill by an incredible margin.
The war will basically almost end itself. The Scourge go from a unified horde to a divided muddle of animals and individuals. It’s not a perfect solution, but...
Would annihilating all of them be a more expedient solution? Of course. But I haven't discovered how to do that. We know that this solution WORKS. At least, it does in small-scale experiments.
And we get to save a sentient species in the process.
Yes, that's a nice bonus. Having an entire species owe us the mother of all favors would be incredible. Could you imagine the wealth and power that will flow through Sorobor as a result?
Turnbull, be honest with me. What are the odds that you'll be able to pull it off?

I don't DO odds. A task is either possible, or impossible. And with a little more effort, I can push it from one to the other. I’m the Dean of Arcane Studies, bending the world to my will is what I do.
But even if my theory is correct, I can't truly make it happen without an actual Immaculate to work this magic on!
If you can save even one Immaculate and bring it here, I will make you an Initiate in the Arcane branch immediately, and handle your Blood Price for you. No catch, I just need your help.
Alright, I’m convinced. You can count on my help.
[PlayerName], I want you to go to the cave the Immaculates are hiding in. It’s in a small mazelike canyon, North of the Cultural District in the East. Get there before the Wolfgang do!
As for you, Desy, I need you to prepare a wagon and get ready to smuggle our new friend back into the city.
Wait, why not send me to the cave first, Gregory? I know the one you’re talking about, I could probably get there faster!
Because [PlayerName] won’t attract any suspicion. Victor thinks they’re on his side. The Wolfgang won’t suspect a thing until it’s too late.
I’m...Not entirely convinced.

I’m aware that this isn’t as ideal as wiping the Scourge out, and that it feels like we’re cooperating with the enemy...But this would be a dramatic shift in the nature of the war. It would save an incredible number of lives.
And how do I know you won’t take advantage of me? I’ve been burned before.

Fair concern. But I’m being upfront and open with you now, aren’t I? I’m leaving myself vulnerable in hopes of convincing you to help me. Do you want our deal in writing as an official contract? Because that can be arranged.
...Alright. I’ll trust you. I’m going to help.
I want it in writing. And Elatt help you if I have to take this to the headmaster.
I assure you that you will not. I’ll have your promotion approved by the time you’re back.
My sister-in Law Helen’s always told me that you’re resourceful, [PlayerName]. Prove it to me.
The two of you pulled it off. Well done. I’ve explained to our new friend here what we plan to do, and he’s willing to cooperate.
Even after we clobbered him? You must have a silver tongue, Turnbull.
HHSSSSS! You should have sent Turnbull himself to speak with me from the start. He is far more convincing than you, human! If any of my kind died in our pointless fight, consider your life marked!
In any case, as far as I'm concerned, you are welcome here in the Arcane Branch, [PlayerName]. Put in the work, and we'll treat you right.

Look, I’ll be blunt, if you’re not a mage, you don’t belong here. But, so long as you remain useful to us, I’ll treat you like anyone else in the branch. Please do consider either becoming a mage, or joining another branch eventually.
I’ll let you know the next time I need you, Initiates. In the meantime, try to keep a low profile. Victor likely won’t take this lying down.
Hey, [PlayerName]. Taking care of yourself?
About as well as I can. You?

I’m working with Gregory Turnbull in the Arcane branch these days. He’s actually got me helping with a particularly...Well, massive project. We’re pushing the limits of what rune magic is capable of. It’s wild stuff.
I didn’t realize you were a mage!
Yup, I visited the Academy’s Ley Line as soon as I got here. I’ll take every tool I can get my hands on. Only a fool, or someone with a VERY specific plan in mind would to otherwise.
Good luck to you, Desy.
Likewise, friend. I hope you get out from under Victor’s thumb sooner than later.
So, Turnbull’s taken you into his confidence too, huh? I hope you able to help us. We need every advantage we can get right now.
You left because Victor made a deal with the Butcher! And now you’re helping Gregory while he’s working with Immaculates! Why the change of heart?

You’re right. I’m not quite comfortable with this...But those Immaculates actually did come to us for help in removing their violent instinct, and Gregory says he can actually do it... I’m willing to give this harebrained scheme a chance.

The Butcher of Men is one thing. Immaculates actively trying to change themselves for the better is another. Besides, this plan might actually shift the terms of war on a level that will help not just family back home, but everyone.
Listen, no one hates the Scourge more than me. I’ve lost friends and family to them. My entire youth was spent on learning how to kill them. And even I’m convinced this plan’s worth a shot.
Huh. I didn’t think this was something you could change your mind over.
Keeping one’s mind and heart open is important to growing and making new allies. This research comes close to the line I won’t cross, but doesn’t step over it. I’m willing to see it to the end.

Well, the thing’s still breathing. Small mercies, huh? I don’t know how Turnbull intends to convince this Immaculate to help us now that we’ve attacked it and its friends, but if he insists we bring one home...

I’ll handle smuggling him into Harmattan. You go take care of the mercenaries outside the cave. I hate to leave that on you, but someone’s got to make sure no one sneaks in here to slit this thing’s throat while it’s down.
So...Come to slay us, have you? You were foolish to come without help, human!
No I’m not! I’m here to help you! I work with Gregory Turnbull!

True, we did come here to receive his aid in ridding us of our instinct to hate and kill our natural enemy. But nearly a full moon we have waited, and now men with spells and steel gather outside our cave with intent to kill. We are clearly betrayed!
You’re not betrayed! I’m here to help you escape!
I swear, I have nothing to do with those men outside!
Is that so? Humans so often claim all Immaculates are the same, yet when we are cornered like vermin, you want us to tell the difference between which human is friend and which is foe?
Why should we trust in you to be any different from those men? Why do you claim to want to help us overcome our killing urge? Why do you CARE, human? We are monsters to your kind!
Even your mortal enemy would prefer peace. Elatt would give your kin a chance.

HHHHSSSSS! Speak not the enemy’s name again, or I will rend your arteries from your flesh and pour the marrow from your bones over my head! ...Even the mere mention of the enemy’s name instills in me a rage I cannot contain!
Less humans will be killed by Scourge. The end of this war benefits everyone.

Hmph. A rational reason, then. I can understand that. It is the same for me. My species is finite. Every human who slays an Immaculate robs the world of their unique voice, thoughts and perspectives. I wish only for the slaying to stop.
It’s called human decency. Some of us really do care.

HAH. I have encountered precisely one kindhearted human being in my hundred years as Immaculate. Why would they name such a thing human decency if it’s not shared by most humans? Perhaps it just means “humans being decent to humans”, hmmm?

We have been taken advantage of before, by people who promised us freedom from our instinctual shackles. Every time, we have either faced disappointment, or worse, betrayal. What makes you think that this time it will be different?
The Arcane Dean is the best mage we have. He can already control an Illuminator.

Can he now? He can control the lowest and weakest of us Scourge like a common pet? Does he really think he will have such success with my kin? To turn us all into his pawns? The language you use, human, it is telling of your master’s motives.
Sorobor has more resources and knowledge than anyone. We CAN make it work.

...So, you are saying that if this last attempt fails, we can give up all hope? Even if this fails, then, it has merit. Whether we are freed, or whether we can cast aside all false hope, I will be able to make peace with my existence... I am tempted, human.
It’s your only shot at survival. If you don’t change, the war will eventually end you all.

Ssss...You strike deeply at my two hearts, human. But this is the truth. The war can only end with our destruction, or a change so great that humanity must re-assess their views of us. It is a grave risk, but one that makes sense to me.

Even if Turnbull can help us...What do you humans intend to do if you succeed in removing our deepest instinct? Will we be freed from our chains, only to find our unity shattered, and easy pickings for your warriors to slay?
I can’t promise there will be peace, even if I personally want it.
A fair answer. I cannot promise that our kind will choose a life of peace either. This fills neither of us with confidence...
Well, I guess you’ll be just like us, won’t you? You’d be like any other human tribe.

So you would assimilate us? Remove what makes us different? There is little difference from that, and using us as your pawns. You dare to think you have that right? It is no wonder you think you can change our very nature!
I could ask the same. Will your kin use their freedom to betray us, or work with us?

I do not have an answer either, human. Many want nothing more than solitude, others revel in their violent instincts, others obey it merely because they know no alternative. I suppose unpredictability is the curse of freedom we would both share...

I will give you and the human Turnbull this chance, then. I will come with you. But you must clear a path for my kin to escape. Those men outside the cave will try to kill us the moment we step outside.
I remain unconvinced. In fact, I believe you were sent here to stall for time, so those men could better spring their trap. You have made your final mistake, human!
(This must be the Heavily Corrupted Mana Stone you’re looking for. You chip off a chunk and stash it in a satchel.)
(This should be one of the replacement valves you need for the new Power Coil!)
(This has to be the container that holds the “Lightning Grease”. It bubbles and sparks as you pour it into a small earthen pot for transportation.)
Victor’s gotten me training with the Wolfgang. I had no idea that Runic Trap spells could be used the way they taught me! We’re so lucky to have such skilled mercenaries working alongside us!

I had my doubts about Victor, but I’m over them. He’s a harsh boss, but he really is trying to do his best to make life safer for us all. I wish Desy was a little more open-minded... She’s wrong about him.
Ugh...Every single one of my muscles is in open revolt...Mining Golems out of a collapsed mountain wall was not a good time. I think you got the easy job!
I’ll remember that next time I need to explore ruins teeming with danger, thanks.
Really? You had to explore ancient ruins to finish the job? You definitely got the more interesting job!
If you count a multi-region journey to be easy, sure.
It is, though, isn’t it? As long as you pace yourself, it’s a nice long hike. Sounds relaxing to me, to be honest!

Did you hear? A pack of Immaculates was spotted up North recently! I hear it was somewhere in the mountains North of the ruined cultural district, in the East! I hope the Wolfgang gets rid of them right quick!

A former explorer came by recently, talking about his last job exploring the Electric Lab in Abrassar Desert. Apparently the job went on long enough that he and his partner nearly fell asleep walking home...And that’s when a hive lord pounced on ‘em...
Bah, yet again Victor tries to keep all the glory of scientific discovery to himself! This is why I can’t stand the man! He’s too damn paranoid!
Would you believe one of my apprentices thinks I know nothing of Alchemy? I know how to make money off of it, isn’t that the same thing?

Did you know? We once elected a council of nobles to lead us. And yet...When the underclasses flooded the upper city to flee the Scourge, every last one of our nobles abandoned us. Things have been better since Sorobor took the reigns of power here.
Forgive my temper today. I’m dealing with a letter I received from my brother, Damian. The man’s paranoia of Elatt knows no bounds anymore! *Sigh* It’s no wonder why Taleron left him!
Damian was so much easier to deal with back when Taleron was his voice of reason!
I worry that one of my scholars is involved in some business he’ll regret out in Abrassar...Risky ventures are one thing...Old Levant is another.
I’m hard at work, figuring out how to help our new friend here. Once I need your help again, I’ll let you know. For now, just give me some space to work, [PlayerName].
Ah! Your arrival is most opportune. We have a serious problem, Initiate.
So, have you heard about how the old Golem production facility started up again, after that rogue Golem made its proclamation just outside? Well, some people have started finding ways inside.
An explorer found a rune wall down in a mine tunnel in there...From his description, I think one of those runes might be exactly what I need in order to crack the Immaculate’s spell wide open.

The problem is, there’s plenty of Scourge that have managed to infiltrate the place as well. The engineering branch just decided that it was highly likely that this tunnel could be used to bypass the walls and invade the city.
And guess who just got the contract to not just guard the tunnel but also collapse it with explosives?
Victor and the Wolfgang Mercenaries, I assume.

Exactly. Now, he could just as easily collapse the tunnel deeper in and let us keep our access to the rune wall, or at least allow me to examine it first. But given our recent...Antagonism...He’s taking more drastic action.

He’s going to collapse the tunnel beyond, in front of, and directly on top of the Rune Wall, permanently blocking all access. And he’s ordered his Wolfgang friends to keep the area clear of any interference, with lethal force if they have to.
What? Why’s he going so over the top with this?
Somehow, I’m not surprised it’s coming to this.

Well, first of all, I think it’s personal at this point. He’s a man who hates to lose control. And not only did you leave his service, you immediately acted against him behind his back. The rumor mill is churning over this and he's losing face.

I suspect his urge right now is to do whatever it takes to solidify his position, and make his opposition, that’s you and me, look as weak as possible right now. Regardless of whether it destroys priceless history or knowledge in the process.

Secondly...I suspect he knows what we’re working on. Having the Scourge hordes become less of a threat means less work for him, and less contracts for the Wolfgang. They all stand to lose business if we succeed.
So he's going to deliberately stop us from fixing the Scourge, by any means, huh?

Precisely. Now, the only one who can officially delay the demolition and get the Wolfgang to stand aside for me is the Headmaster. And he’s been summoned to Berg to be questioned by the Blue Chamber over a recent incident there.

The demolition is scheduled to take place in about 20 days. The headmaster is unlikely to get back before then, and no one from Sorobor is even allowed to see him at the moment. So, unless that demolition suffers some mysterious setbacks...
Can't I just write down the runes and show them to you?
Oh really. How familiar are you with Rune Magic, Initiate?
Uh...Not at all, actually.
Right, so...Why are you even offering? Rune Magic doesn’t work like that.
I know the basics.
Uh huh. Well, let me explain some advanced theory to you.
I know the Advanced Syntax.
Oh. Impressive. But you see the problem then, right?

Runes have a multitude of contexts depending on positioning, ordering and inflection. It's like a language where each letter’s meaning can change drastically. Each rune also has a magical signature that can't be passed on with just sketches.
You’re asking me to commit sabotage.

If I have just a sketch, which I already do, I can hazard a guess at how to compel the rune, but I'm still just shooting fireballs in the dark. I might succeed, or I might trigger some completely unintended and unhelpful effect.
I would much rather avoid any unpleasant surprises, thank you. Do not “wing it”, as you humans say, unless you absolutely must.
I've got an especially good eidetic memory, I just need 15 minutes in front of that wall and I'll know everything I need to know. But if I don't get that delay...
How essential is this one rune?
It’s important enough that I'm asking you to perform sabotage against a Dean and put your life in danger. I’m not asking this of you lightly.
A few mysterious setbacks, coming right up, then!
...This had better pay real well. You’re asking me to risk my entire career.
I’ve spent the last few hours putting together the details of the job. Here's what we know for sure.

One, the tunnel in question is in the part of the factory accessible through a Ruined Golem Warehouse, in the old battlefield just beyond the front gate. I don’t know how the Wolfgang got a key to the place, but you’ll likely need your own.
Two, the Wolfgang Mercs have been hired to run security for the mine tunnel. There are at least 2 guys, plus one dog Golem with the new Power Coil model as backup patrolling near the tunnel entrance.
Three, The mercs have also been hired to provide the explosives, although in order to get certain materials, they're taking out a series of loans from the Mercantile Provost.
Four, The Engineering Branch said they've detected another splinter tunnel that goes into the part of the factory under the Mana lake, near the Troglodyte Warren down there.
So, I've put together five options we could pursue to delay the project. Here’s the plan...

Option 1, remove the Power Coil from the Dog Golem that’s guarding the tunnel, and replace it with this busted one. The Golem will be on low power Scourge detection mode, so you should be able to sneak up and make the switch easily.

Do that, and they'll need to scramble to get a replacement. If possible, avoid confronting the actual mercenaries there. Considering how important destroying the tunnel is...Conflict there could have lasting consequences on our reputation.

Option 2, sabotage the detonators that the mercs will use. They're likely to use three explosive packages, which they should be keeping at their camp. All you need to do is swap the red wires in the bombs with the blue ones, and they won't work as intended.

Option 3, if that side-tunnel that goes under the mana lake is actually connected to a trog burrow, throw this pot of Helen’s Troglodyte Pesticide down there. It’ll flush them towards the mine tunnel where they’ll sow confusion among the guards.

And lastly, we can try to call in a favor or two from the academy’s provosts. You might be able to convince the Mercantile provost, Sekiguchi, to withhold the next few loans, which will force the Wolfgang to delay.
Finally, the Academic Provost, Hugo, is nominally the head of Sorobor while the Headmaster is gone. A letter from him to delay the demolition might buy us a little time.
Now, get this done swiftly and thoroughly, but try not to go overboard, alright? We just need to buy some time, not shut the entire operation down.
I'd split this between you and Desy, but I’ve sent her to Berg to go request an official response from the Headmaster. I don't know if I can trust the rest of my branch, so you're all I've got.
You trust me more than people who you’ve worked with for years?
In general? No. For dealing with Victor? Yes. I know that in no uncertain terms he has it out for you. You have no reason to go back to him.
I’m on it. I’ll be back when I’m done.
So, how’s the mission going? Do you have an update for me?
I'm not done just yet...
I’m done.
Can you run the plan by me again?
Alright, I’ll go over the plan again. Listen up!
You weren’t able to get a single task done? *sigh* I really expected more of you.
Are you sure? You’re positive that we can’t make the outcome more certain?
I'm positive we're in the clear. Any more would be unsafe.
This looks like it’ll be close. Very close. But it should work. Good job out there [PlayerName].
It feels like you did a little bit of overkill, but better safe than sorry. Excellent work, [PlayerName].

Good job out the-...Wait, you did everything on the list? Didn't I say not to go overboard? Well, let's just hope that doesn’t have unintended consequences. We actually do need that tunnel blocked before the Scourge use it...
Well...All we can do now is wait until Desy comes back with news from the Headmaster...
Hah! Success! You delayed the demolition long enough that Desy was able to get an official letter from the headmaster through! I have both the time and the authority to go examine that Rune Wall!
Excellent work, [PlayerName]. You’ve earned your reward. Now, I have runes to memorize!
Word just came in. They’ve gone and demolished the tunnel....
*sigh* I guess we’ll just have to make do without that critical rune. You did put your life on the line, so I can’t in good conscience deny you a reward...But damn if this doesn’t sting.
(This looks like one of the bombs that will be used to demolish the tunnel)
Time to sabotage this thing...
(You easily swap the wires. This bomb has been successfully sabotaged!)
(That’s all three bombs sabotaged. This objective is completed!)
(The dog Golem is on low-power mode, as expected. You could easily swap its Power Coil for the defective one)
(You swap the Coil with little difficulty. The Dog Golem has been successfully sabotaged!)
(This is definitely the Troglodyte Tunnel that Gregory told you about. Throwing the Trog Pesticide down there should flush them away from the entrance, and down further, towards the mine tunnel).
I’ll just chuck that Troglodyte Pesticide down there...
(Almost immediately, you hear gurgled screams of discomfort from the tunnel, and the thudding of Troglodyte feet fleeing deeper inside. Looks like the plan is working!)

I’m not sure you’re aware, but the Blue Chamber Collective and Levant have gone to war. This is a very strong time to turn a profit in the sale of supplies or weapons. I’d advise you to jump on this chance on this before the war cools off!
I need a favor...I need you to squeeze the Wolfgang Mercenaries finances a little.
Oh, is that all? And why, pray tell, is that?
It’s...Ah...A trade secret.
I suppose I could hold off on their next loan of cash for a few days...But the question is, what’s in it for me? Tell me, [PlayerName] are you frightened of ghosts?

Hmm. Well, I do owe you a little favor for that business with the vanishing pilgrims...That information has been a gold mine for me. Very well, I’ll hold off on their next loan for a few days, just for you, my friend.
Ghosts don’t scare me. I can handle them in a fight if I need to.
Ghosts? No thank you, I don’t want to hear any more of this!

Very well. Up to the north is Old Harmattan, the old district where the elected nobles of the last age of this city governed. They barricaded themselves in there during the worst of the Scourge assault.

Well, the place is wall-to-wall ghosts now. No one is permitted to open that front gate, for fear that the ghosts will start roaming the region searching for prey. They seem content enough to stay put otherwise.
Enclosed in that living tomb with all their riches, we can only assume they all turned on one another and refused to move on out of spite or misery. I want a specific kind of wealth from them.
There should be an old ledger somewhere in there, with records of ancient debts. I should be able to...Hmmm...Hold that over a handful of people. The threat alone of that knowledge would be enough.

I’ve heard tell that the ledger was stored in a basement, near the outer walls, far from the sealed doors. Find that basement, grab the ledger, and bring it to me. Only then will I take care of this little favor for you.
I got your ledger for you!

So it really does exist...And it’s in better condition than I expected! Yes, I think I’m going to be able to put this to some very good use, yes indeed...Consider those loans to the Wolfgang Mercenaries delayed, Initiate.
(This looks like the ledger you were tasked with retrieving. Better bring it to the Mercantile Provost.)
I loathe whenever the Headmaster has to leave the city. Everyone comes to me for any individual problem! As if I didn’t have enough work on my plate already!

I can’t see why the Chamberlords would have reason to think the Headmaster could have anything to do with the attack on their recent council meeting. At least, not enough reason to justify demanding he make the journey all the way to Berg!
I need a favor. I need a letter asking for the delay of that tunnel demolition.
I see...Do you understand how essential it is to shut that tunnel down? For something this important, only the Headmaster would have the authority to delay it, even for a single day!
That said...You’ve done VERY right by me already, what with that evidence you picked up in the marsh. I’ll return the favor. Just give me a moment...

Well, look what I found just lying around! A letter, demanding a single day’s delay for the demolition, with the Headmaster’s signature on it! Don’t tell anyone where it came from or I’ll see to it you’re expelled, understand?

By the by, have I told you that I offer *ahem* “Calligraphy lessons”? 300 Silver, paid in advance, and I can show you how to sign your name all fancy, just like the headmaster does. ...Do you follow what I’m really saying?
Yes sir, I understand exactly what you mean. I’ll be back with the money shortly.
On second thought, this sounds far too risky. Forget I said anything.
Here’s your 300 silver. Now, about those lessons...
Nevermind the lessons. Here, I have a “practice letter” for you. It’s written exactly in the headmaster’s style, and the signature will match precisely.
And it’s a letter about delaying a tunnel demolition! What a happy “coincidence”.
Indeed. Now, let us never speak of this again. Don’t tell anyone where this came from, or I’ll see you expelled, understand?
I know what your master is doing. The Tracker Coil doesn’t lie. There’s literally an Immaculate somewhere in Harmattan! You and Turnbull brought the enemy into our city!

I think I know what you’re trying to do with those Immaculates. You’re trying to change them. But you won’t be able to. You can’t change what you are. Even IF you change their nature, there’s nothing stopping them from killing by choice.
Is Victor at least treating you alright?
He’s made me a full Scholar for my work. The Wolfgang’s been training me personally. And trust me, we’re going to find those missing Immaculates and destroy them.

Please, stop letting Turnbull manipulate you. It’s bad enough he somehow got to Desy. I can’t understand how she could leave Victor over him trying to trap the Butcher, only to turn around and work with the enemy herself! It’s insanity!
Victor literally made a deal with the Butcher. We’re just trying to stop the Scourge.
Wrong. Victor tried to USE the Butcher of Men, he tried to trap him. You are literally working with the enemy! You really think those...Monsters can be saved? If you do, you are naive to the extreme.
They are using you. Even if you can end their hatred of Elatt, they’ll just use that to pretend to be reformed, and then they’ll stab us all in the back. It’s in their very nature to kill!
Your Turnbull is not gentle in his magical prodding. I can only hope he finds the solution he seeks before my patience wears out...
It’s noble of you to want to “fix” yourself.

Hmph. Don’t patronize me, human. I find it...Upsetting that my nature drives me to kill and maim. Ending life relieves my suffering, yes, but it hurts something deep inside me. Some ancient memory that is forever just inches from my grasp.

I gave up long ago on recollecting what I was before I awoke as Immaculate. All that matters is what I do with my life in the present moment. And what I want is peace. Freedom. The chance to create a future for myself of my own choosing.
You called those other Immaculates your Kin... Are they...Family?

Family...That word is familiar, but I’m not certain. All Immaculates can tell one another apart without need for names, or personal connection to one another. We form packs based on shared goals or ideas. So...No, they are not “family”.

I suppose I call other Immaculates my kin because we CAN form these bonds with one another. I pity the Grotesques...They may share our physical form, but they lack the ability to feel, and think as we do. It...Unsettles me to be honest.

I am thankful I was spared that fate. To see a mirror image of myself, a mindless animal motivated only by our killing urge...It is one of the reasons I decided I must find a way to cast off these magical shackles and become free.
So, you know that what drives you to kill is the effect of a spell, right?

Yes, Turnbull proved it to me. I should be enraged, but instead, I feel only anguish. My freedom is shackled, because a human made it so. And yet...I feel like we were never intended. Like we are some unhappy mistake that should never have been.
